metadata.title: CVE-2024-46673 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: aacraid: Fix double-free on probe failureaac_probe_one() calls hardware-specific init functions through theaac_driver_ident::init pointer, all of which eventually call down toaac_init_adapter().If aac_init_adapter() fails after allocating memory for aac_dev::queues,it frees the memory but does not clear that member.After the hardware-specific init function returns an error,aac_probe_one() goes down an error path that frees the memory pointed toby aac_dev::queues, resulting.in a double-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-lowlatency - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1174-aws - 4.15.0-1174.187~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1182-azure - 4.15.0-1182.197~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1167-gcp - 4.15.0-1167.184~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1136-oracle - 4.15.0-1136.147~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-260.294').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1138.148').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1175.190').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1174.187~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1182.197~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1167.184~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1136.147~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
